SEARCH

Class Client

java.lang.Object
Client
public class Client extends Object
The `Client` class serves as the main entry point for the Student Grade System program. It provides a menu-driven interface for managing student information.

This class includes methods to perform operations such as adding new students, updating grades, and generating reports.

Version:
1.0
Author:
[Khon Min Thite]

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, InputMismatchException, NotSortedException
      The main method that drives the Student Grade System program. This method provides a menu-driven interface for managing student information. Users can perform various operations like loading data from a file, displaying student details, removing a student, analyzing grades, and more.

      Precondition: The program assumes that the necessary methods (e.g., loadStudentsInformationFromFile, removeStudentByStudentNumber, etc.) are implemented and handle their respective functionalities correctly.

      Postconditions: The program exits when the user chooses option 1 to exit the program. The state of the students' information may be modified based on user actions during the program's execution.

      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used in this program).
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during file operations.
      InputMismatchException - If the user enters invalid input.
      NotSortedException - If student ArrayList is not sorted.

    • studentInformation

      public static void studentInformation()
      Displays student information.

    • menuDisplay

      public static void menuDisplay()
      Displays the menu options for the program.

    • loadStudentsInformationFromFile

      public static void loadStudentsInformationFromFile(ArrayList<Student> students, String fileName) throws NumberFormatException, FileNotFoundException
      Loads student information from a file and populates the provided ArrayList of Student objects.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList to store the loaded Student objects.
      fileName - The name of the file containing student information.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If invalid format
      FileNotFoundException - If file is not found.

    • removeStudentByStudentNumber

      public static void removeStudentByStudentNumber(long studentNumber)
      Removes a student from the ArrayList based on the provided student number after user confirmation.
      Parameters:
      studentNumber - The student number of the student to be removed.

    • displayAllStudentDetails

      public static void displayAllStudentDetails(ArrayList<Student> students)
      Displays detailed information for all students in the provided ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList containing the Student objects to be displayed.

    • analyzeStudentGrades

      public static void analyzeStudentGrades(ArrayList<Student> students)
      Analyzes student grades based on their overall marks, displaying average overall marks, and the number of students above and below the average.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList containing the Student objects to be analyzed.

    • reportGradeOfStudent

      public static void reportGradeOfStudent(ArrayList<Student> students, long studentNumber)
      Reports the grade of a student with a given student number. If the student is found, their grade is reported; otherwise, a message is printed.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList of Student objects to search through.
      studentNumber - The student number of the student whose grade is to be reported.

    • sortStudentsByStudentNumber

      public static void sortStudentsByStudentNumber(ArrayList<Student> students)
      Sorts an ArrayList of Student objects based on their student numbers using sorting algorithm.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList of Student objects to be sorted.

    • outputSortedStudentsToCSV

      public static void outputSortedStudentsToCSV(ArrayList<Student> students, String fileName) throws IOException, NotSortedException
      Outputs the sorted student data to a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      students - The ArrayList of Student objects containing sorted data.
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to write the data to.
      Throws:
      IOException - If writing to CSV file fails.
      NotSortedException - If ArrayList is not sorted
